Description: Ostracon, fragment of shoulder and neck section of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of a Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394298) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394298)
